repo.name: Findomain
repo.description: The fastest and complete solution for domain recognition. Supports screenshoting, port scan, HTTP check, data import from other tools, subdomain monitoring, alerts via Discord, Slack and Telegram, multiple API Keys for sources and much more.

readme.summary: Clear feature overview but lacks practical quick-start examples and troubleshooting guidance in the main README.
readme.top_issue: No basic usage example in README - users must navigate to external docs to learn how to actually run the tool

injection_risks.description: SQL string concatenation vulnerability in the query_findomain_database function, where user input is directly concatenated into SQL queries without proper sanitization.
SQL string concatenation vulnerability in the return_existing_subdomains function, where user input is directly concatenated into SQL queries without proper sanitization.

critical_findings: SQL injection vulnerabilities in the database module.
Insecure default configuration for TLS connections.
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including SQL injection vulnerabilities and insecure default configurations, which need to be addressed to ensure the security of the application.

common_complaints: Configuration not being respected (Discord webhook still active after commenting out)
Tool not switching between notification methods properly
Rate limiting issues from excessive requests
sentiment.summary: Single unresolved issue with no maintainer response indicates potential abandonment or low activity, with the user reporting a configuration bug that persists despite attempting to disable a feature.

communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and patient, though could improve in technical depth.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit on 2026-01-06
13 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no development activity
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process is defunct
maintenance.summary: findomain appears to be abandoned with no maintenance activity, issue resolution, or development in the past 6 months despite having unresolved open issues.

project_metrics.description: The fastest and complete solution for domain recognition. Supports screenshoting, port scan, HTTP check, data import from other tools, subdomain monitoring, alerts via Discord, Slack and Telegram, multiple API Keys for sources and much more.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is comprehensive, but lacks a clear and concise quick start guide to help new users get started with the package.
concerns: Docs: Lack of a simple, step-by-step example for basic usage
Security: SQL injection vulnerabilities in the database module.
Security: Insecure default configuration for TLS connections.
Security: SQL string concatenation vulnerability in the query_findomain_database function, where user input is directly concatenated into SQL queries without proper sanitization.
Security: SQL string concatenation vulnerability in the return_existing_subdomains function, where user input is directly concatenated into SQL queries without proper sanitization.
High bus factor risk (91% from top contributor)
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (47)
A significant number of merged PRs in the past six months (41)
Recent open issues and PRs indicate ongoing development
